results.title: Baby and the bottle
results.creator_credit: Cambridge FIlm T V Productions and David Bilcock
results.brief_description: This film describes and demonstrates the bottle feeding of a baby. It points out important details which must be observed to ensure satisfactory feeding and demonstrates preparation and sterilization methods, including terminal sterilization whereby several bottles can be prepared and stored for future use.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cambridge FIlm T V Productions and David Bilcock

results.title: Baboons
results.brief_description: Part of a series called “Zoo animals in the wild”, this film shows the baboon travelling in troops, looking for food and caring for its young. Suitable for mid-upper Primary school. No other credits available.

results.title: Baboon social organization
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles and C. Cameron Macauley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Baboon Social Life”.
Analyses the nature of the interdependence within a baboon troop and its close relation to baboon ecology. Discusses the role of central males, peripheral males, mothers with infants and juveniles. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Baboon development: the older infant, four months to one year (Nairobi Park)
results.creator_credit: National Science Foundation, Ford Foundation, Educational Services and Quentin Brown
results.brief_description: Part of a series of films on the baboons of Kenya. Shows without commentary or narration, the growth and development of a baby baboon over one year of its life.

results.title: Babies with bad hearts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Your life in their hands”.
Shows surgical treatment of heart defects in very young children, at the Heart Unit of the Hospital for Sick Children in London.

results.title: Babies need books
results.creator_credit: New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation and New Zealand Trade & Enterprise
results.brief_description: A mother, grandmother, teacher and children’s bookseller, Dorothy Butler believes that books should play a crucial role in children’s lives right from the first months. The film is an informative and entertaining introduction to 58 favourite children’s books.

results.title: Babies Are People Too (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An anti-child abuse film for young mothers to give them a better understanding of how their infants develop during the first two years and how behaviour is an expression of their infant’s needs. The objective is to make better mothers, and hence, better adjusted babies.
results.description: An anti-child abuse film for young mothers to give them a better understanding of how their infants develop during the first two years and how behaviour is an expression of their infant’s needs. The objective is to make better mothers, and hence, better adjusted babies.

results.title: Babette's Feast = Babettes Gaestebud
results.creator_credit: Panorama Film A/S, Nordisk Films Kompagni, Danish Film Institute, Just Betzer, Bo Christensen and Gabriel Axel
results.brief_description: Exquisitely, delicately told tale of two beautiful young daughters of a minister, who pass up love and fame to remain in their small Danish village. They grow old, using religion as a substitute for living life … and then take in Babette, a Parisian refugee, a woman with a very special secret. Babette wins 10,000 francs in a lottery and spends it all on preparing a sumptuous banquet for her Lutheran employers and their friends. Based on a short story by Isak Dinesen (Karen Blixen). Stars Stephane Audran in the title role with Jean-Philippe Lafont, Jarl Kulle and Bibi Andersson.
